td.content: Hyperinflation, depressed diaphragms, increased retrosternal space

td.content: s:pt presents w/ c/o 7 days h/o critical shortness of breath, critical cough, critical dyspnea and Respiratory. patient is a female bookkeeper aged 55 Ys. she denies drinking alcohol she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life o:Height 160 cm, Weight 63.3 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 15, FEV1 FEV1=35 %, FEV1/FVC FEV1/FVC=60 %, Arterial Blood Gas PaCO2=44 mmHg,PaO2=58 mmHg, plum: accessory muscle use, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, rales Bil a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:administered OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN via nasal cannula (contin), performed FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Arterial Blood Gas, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:patient with critical shortness of breath, critical dyspnea and critical cough. she has had several such episodes over past 10 months. pt is a white f aged 57 ys. she denies drinking alcohol she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life o:Height 160 cm, Weight 63.7 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, Chest X-Ray Hyperinflation, depressed diaphragms, increased retrosternal space, plum: accessory muscle use, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, rales Bil a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:administered OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN via nasal cannula (contin), performed Chest X-Ray, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
